remarks: Existence of a minimal element in certain classes: if ` R ` is well-founded and set-like on ` A ` , then every nonempty subclass of ` A ` has a minimal element.  The proof has been taken from Chapter 4 of Don Monk's notes on Set Theory.  See ~ http://euclid.colorado.edu/~~monkd/setth.pdf .  (Contributed by Jonathan Ben-Naim, 3-Jun-2011.)  (New usage is discouraged.)

$d A y $.
$d B w y $.
$d R x y $.
$d w x y $.
